newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada-Chicago gas pipe group extends open season.
newsitem.headline: Canada-Chicago gas pipe group extends open season.

text.p: Backers of the proposed Alliance Pipeline, a natural gas line that would run to Chicago from northern Canada, said on Wednesday it extended its open season to November 8 from Oct 31.

"During the first four weeks of its open season, Alliance has met with over 100 potential shippers," the partnership said. "The open season extension will ensure that all potential shippers have fair and open access to Alliance capacity."
The line, backed by 18 Canadian companies, would carry 1.25 billion cubic feet of gas to Chicago by 1999.
The partnership includes such comapnies as Alberta Energy Co Ltd, Gulf Canada Resources Ltd and IPL Energy Inc.
The companies said the extension would not affect the project's planned in-service daite.
The C$3.6-billion project would run 3,000 km to the U.S. Midwest from northeastern British Columbia as a way of boosting natural gas export capacity from Canada.
The scarcity of takeaway capacity has often been blamed for western Canadian gas prices being much lower than those in the United States. -- Reuters Calgary Bureau 403 531-1624
